instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3437 Short to ground on F7140 (PPBUS_G3H)
threads.message: How can i find whats shortage i tied the psu to it and reved up the current was pulling 5 amps nothing was getting hot to touch.....

threads.title: 820-3437 Short to ground on F7140 (PPBUS_G3H)
threads.message: Remove the fuse. Which side is the short on?

threads.title: 820-3437 Short to ground on F7140 (PPBUS_G3H)
threads.message: Pin 1 gives me .095 on multimeter diode   pin 2 gives .000

threads.title: 820-3437 Short to ground on F7140 (PPBUS_G3H)
threads.message: Inject voltage on pin 2. Feel around. Raise amps. Also, What's the history on this? Liquid?

threads.title: 820-3437 Short to ground on F7140 (PPBUS_G3H)
threads.message: 5 amps should get something hot for sure unless it is a hard short inside the board.

threads.title: 820-3437 Short to ground on F7140 (PPBUS_G3H)
threads.message: No liquid. She said it wouldn't turn on after the hurricane we had here. But I thoroughly checked for liquid damage couldn't find any. I'm guessing power surge or something.

threads.title: 820-3437 Short to ground on F7140 (PPBUS_G3H)
threads.message: Yeah like duke said if nothing is getting hot it is internal to the pcb.
